data.value: Given inputs for a linear programming problem in preferred format, presolve the problem: identify trivial infeasibilities, redundancies, and unboundedness, tighten bounds where possible, and eliminate fixed variables.

data.type_: A `scipy.optimize._linprog_util._LPProblem` consisting of the following fields:

_lines._line: c : 1D array
The coefficients of the linear objective function to be minimized.

data.value: c : 1D array
The coefficients of the linear objective function to be minimized.

_lines._line: A_ub : 2D array, optional
The inequality constraint matrix. Each row of ``A_ub`` specifies the
coefficients of a linear inequality constraint on ``x``.

data.value: A_ub : 2D array, optional
The inequality constraint matrix. Each row of
specifies the coefficients of a linear inequality constraint on

_lines._line: b_ub : 1D array, optional
The inequality constraint vector. Each element represents an
upper bound on the corresponding value of ``A_ub @ x``.

data.value: b_ub : 1D array, optional
The inequality constraint vector. Each element represents an upper bound on the corresponding value of

_lines._line: A_eq : 2D array, optional
The equality constraint matrix. Each row of ``A_eq`` specifies the
coefficients of a linear equality constraint on ``x``.

data.value: A_eq : 2D array, optional
The equality constraint matrix. Each row of
specifies the coefficients of a linear equality constraint on

_lines._line: b_eq : 1D array, optional
The equality constraint vector. Each element of ``A_eq @ x`` must equal
the corresponding element of ``b_eq``.

data.value: b_eq : 1D array, optional
The equality constraint vector. Each element of
must equal the corresponding element of

_lines._line: bounds : 2D array
The bounds of ``x``, as ``min`` and ``max`` pairs, one for each of the N
elements of ``x``. The N x 2 array contains lower bounds in the first
column and upper bounds in the 2nd. Unbounded variables have lower
bound -np.inf and/or upper bound np.inf.

data.value: bounds : 2D array

. The N x 2 array contains lower bounds in the first column and upper bounds in the 2nd. Unbounded variables have lower bound -np.inf and/or upper bound np.inf.

_lines._line: x0 : 1D array, optional
Guess values of the decision variables, which will be refined by
the optimization algorithm. This argument is currently used only by the
'revised simplex' method, and can only be used if `x0` represents a
basic feasible solution.

data.value: x0 : 1D array, optional
Guess values of the decision variables, which will be refined by the optimization algorithm. This argument is currently used only by the 'revised simplex' method, and can only be used if
represents a basic feasible solution.
If
attempts to eliminate any redundant rows in
. Set False if
is known to be of full row rank, or if you are looking for a potential speedup (at the expense of reliability).
Method used to identify and remove redundant rows from the equality constraint matrix after presolve.
The tolerance which determines when a solution is "close enough" to zero in Phase 1 to be considered a basic feasible solution or close enough to positive to serve as an optimal solution.

Guess values of the decision variables, which will be refined by the optimization algorithm. This argument is currently used only by the 'revised simplex' method, and can only be used if
represents a basic feasible solution.
Constant term in objective function due to fixed (and eliminated) variables.
Solution vector (when the solution is trivial and can be determined in presolve)

the functions in the list reverse the operations of _presolve() the function signature is x_org = f(x_mod), where x_mod is the result of a presolve step and x_org the value at the start of the step (currently, the revstack contains only one function)
Whether the solution is complete (solved or determined to be infeasible or unbounded in presolve)
An integer representing the exit status of the optimization::

_lines._line: 0 : Optimization terminated successfully
1 : Iteration limit reached
2 : Problem appears to be infeasible
3 : Problem appears to be unbounded
4 : Serious numerical difficulties encountered

data.value: A string descriptor of the exit status of the optimization.
